org.opensha2.eq.model

Class HazardModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha2.eq.model.HazardModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<SourceSet<? extends Source>>, Named

    public final class HazardModel
extends Object
implements Iterable<SourceSet<? extends Source>>, Named
    A HazardModel is the top-level wrapper for earthquake Source definitions and attendant GroundMotionModels used in probabilisitic seismic hazard analyses (PSHAs) and related calculations. A HazardModel contains of a number of SourceSets that define logical groupings of sources by SourceType. Each SourceSet carries with it references to the GroundMotionModels and associated weights to be used when evaluating hazard.
    Author:
    Peter Powers
    See Also:
    Source, SourceSet, SourceType

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static HazardModel load(Path path)
        Load a HazardModel from a directory or Zip file specified by the supplied path.

        For more information on a HazardModel directory and file structure, see the nshmp-haz wiki.

        Notes: HazardModel loading is not thread safe. Also, there are a wide variety of exceptions that may be encountered when loading a model. In most cases, the exception will be logged and the JVM will exit.

        Parameters:
        path - to HazardModel directory or Zip file
        Returns:
        a newly instantiated HazardModel
